data.scheme_name: Uttar Pradesh Warehousing and Logistics Policy 2022 - Storage facilities - Back end subsidies - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides Capital Subsidy upto maximum of Rs.500 lakhs for setting up warehouse, silo, cold chain facilities anywhere in the State.
data.eligibility: All existing units who wants to setup Storage facility project (Warehouse, Silo and Cold Chain facility) are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions:
Eligible Storage facility project include setting up:

Warehouse facility: Developed over minimum area of 1lakh sq.ft and minimum Capital Investment of Rs.2000 lakhs.

Silo: Developed over minimum area of 4-acres and minimum Capital Investment of Rs.3000 lakhs.

Cold Chain Facility: Developed over minimum area of 20,000sq.ft and minimum Capital Investment of Rs.1500 lakhs.

Eligibility Investment Period starts from the first investment date within the effective period and lasts up to 3 years or until commercial operations begin, whichever is earlier.

Stamp duty exemption is for a period of 10 years.

Applicant needs to submit Bank Guarantee, released upon starting commercial operations.

The exemptions shall be provided by the department only on verification of the unique ID issued by the Nodal Agency.

Eligible Capital Investment refers to capital investment made during the eligible investment period. If investment starts before the effective date, at least 80% must be made after the effective date for it to be considered eligible for incentives.
data.beneficiaries: All existing units who wants to setup Storage facility project (Warehouse, Silo and Cold Chain facility) are eligible under this scheme.
data.prerequisites:
Eligible Storage facility project include setting up:

Warehouse facility: Developed over minimum area of 1lakh sq.ft and minimum Capital Investment of Rs.2000 lakhs.

Silo: Developed over minimum area of 4-acres and minimum Capital Investment of Rs.3000 lakhs.

Cold Chain Facility: Developed over minimum area of 20,000sq.ft and minimum Capital Investment of Rs.1500 lakhs.

Eligibility Investment Period starts from the first investment date within the effective period and lasts up to 3 years or until commercial operations begin, whichever is earlier.

Stamp duty exemption is for a period of 10 years.

Applicant needs to submit Bank Guarantee, released upon starting commercial operations.

The exemptions shall be provided by the department only on verification of the unique ID issued by the Nodal Agency.

Eligible Capital Investment refers to capital investment made during the eligible investment period. If investment starts before the effective date, at least 80% must be made after the effective date for it to be considered eligible for incentives.
data.nodal_agency: Uttar Pradesh State Industrial Development Authority (UPSIDA)
data.context: Logistics is crucial in the global economy as it facilitates the exchange of goods and services for money through trade. This industry not only fosters economic growth but also addresses environmental and social concerns.
data.objective: The UP Government aims to enhance warehousing and logistics infrastructure, encourage private investment, create jobs, and adopt smart logistics methods through a new policy.
data.description:
Scheme provides various incentives for setting up Warehouse, Silo and Cold Chain Facility:

Capital Subsidy: 15% of eligible capital investment upto max of Rs.500 lakhs, or Rs.1000 lakhs in designated Logistics Zones.

Electricity Duty Exemption: 100% exemption for 10 years.

Quality Certification Cost Reimbursement: 50% reimbursement of certification costs, up to Rs.5 lakh per project.

Skill Development Subsidy: Rs.0.01 lakhs per trainee per month for 6 months, up to 50 trainees per year for 5 years per project.

Note : Total benefits, including exemptions, cannot exceed 100% of eligible capital investment.
data.how_to_apply: The applicant can register themselves to the given following link: https://niveshmitra.up.nic.in/Default.aspx
data.funding_facilitator: Uttar Pradesh State Industrial Development Authority (UPSIDA)
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get the incentives after the approval of the concerned authority.
data.checklist_info_a:
Project Proposal/Business Plan
Proof of Land Ownership or Lease Agreement
Company Registration Documents
PAN Card and GST Registration
Bank Guarantee (if required for exemptions)
Environmental Clearance (if applicable)
Affidavit or Undertaking for Project Commitment
Financial Statements (Balance Sheets, Profit & Loss)
Proof of Eligibility for Incentives (e.g., investment details)
Proof of Compliance with Local Authority Regulations
Approvals from Industrial/Development Authorities (if applicable)
